meanings.definition: The retention of juvenile features in the adult form of an animal.
meanings.sent1: Neoteny is when an animal keeps its young traits as it grows up.
meanings.sent2: The neoteny of some animals makes them look cute even when they are fully grown.
meanings.sent3: The neoteny of the puppy made everyone smile at its playful behavior.
meanings.sent4: Her face showed a neoteny that belied her age, making her seem forever young.
meanings.sent5: The neoteny of the kitten with its big eyes and small size was irresistible.

meanings.definition: The condition of retaining juvenile characteristics in adulthood.
meanings.sent1: Neoteny refers to the condition where adult animals still have traits of their youth.
meanings.sent2: Some people exhibit neoteny by maintaining childlike curiosity throughout their lives.
meanings.sent3: His neoteny was evident in his love for cartoons and toys even as a grown man.
meanings.sent4: In her laughter and innocence, she embodied the neoteny of a child in an adult's body.
meanings.sent5: The neoteny of his behavior made him endearing to everyone he met.
